additional_information: type-A negative response regulator

additional_information: Rav2 is part of a complex that has been named 'regulator of the (H+)-ATPase of the vacuolar and endosomal membranes' (RAVE)

additional_information: Calcium-binding EF-hand family protein. Includes putative, calmodulin and calmodulin like.

name: PAD4[AT3G52430]
additional_information: Encodes a lipase-like gene that is important for salicylic acid signaling and function in resistance (R) gene-mediated and basal plant disease resistance.

name: EDS1[AT3G48090]
additional_information: Component of R gene-mediated disease resistance in Arabidopsis thaliana with homology to eukaryotic lipases.
description: enhanced disease susceptibility, alpha/beta-Hydrolases superfamily protein

name: MPK3,6[AT2G43790,AT3G45640]
additional_information: Encodes a MAP kinase induced by pathogens, ethylene biosynthesis, oxidative stress and osmotic stress.

name: TDX[AT3G17880]
additional_information: Tetraticopeptide domain-containing thioredoxin; Encodes a thioredoxin-like disulfide reductase. The protein interacts with the yeast Hsp70 protein Ssb2 in vitro. This interaction is sensitive to the redox status of the thioredoxin domain of AtTDX.

name: RBC[AT1G67090,AT5G38430,ATCG00490]
additional_information: Encodes a member of the Rubisco small subunit (RBCS) multigene family: RBCS1A (AT1G67090), RBCS1B (AT5G38430), RBCS2B (AT5G38420), and RBCS3B (AT5G38410). Large subunit of RUBISCO (ATCG00490) protein is tyrosine-phosphorylated and its phosphorylation state is modulated in response to ABA in Arabidopsis thaliana seeds. When phosphorylated it is modulated in response to ABA. Functions to yield sufficient Rubisco content for leaf photosynthetic capacity. RuBisCO catalyzes two reactions- the carboxylation of D- ribulose 1,5-bisphosphate, the primary event in carbon dioxide fixation, as well as the oxidative fragmentation of the pentose substrate. Both reactions occur simultaneously and in competition at the same active site.

name: OBE1[AT3G07780]
additional_information: Together with OBE2, required for the maintenance and/or establishment of both the shoot and root meristems, probably by controlling the expression of the meristem genes such as WUS, PLT1 and PLT2 and of genes required for auxin responses. Promotes cell meristematic activity via the WUSCHEL-CLAVATA pathway. Involved in the development of the basal pole and in auxin-mediated root and vascular development in the embryo. Confers sensitivity to turnip mosaic virus (TuMV) probably by promoting viral movement and multiplication via interaction with TuMV VPg.

name: RH8[AT4G00660]
additional_information: Putative; involved in viral reproduction, viral-host interaction; ATP-dependent RNA helicase involved in mRNA turnover, and more specifically in mRNA decapping.

name: ETR[AT1G04310,AT1G66340,AT2G40940,AT3G04580,AT3G23150]
additional_information: ERS1, ERS2 have no receiver domain. ETR1, EIN4, ETR2 have receiver domain on the C terminus.

name: RAR1[AT5G51700]
additional_information: Required for R protein accumulation. Functions as positive regulator of RPS5 accumulation by assisting its stabilization. May function as co-chaperone of HSP90-2 to positively regulate the steady-state accumulation of RPM1 and protect it from SGT1- mediated degradation.
description: resistance signalling protein, cysteine and histidine-rich domain-containing protein

name: SGT1[AT4G11260,AT4G23570]
additional_information: two functionally redundant proteins in resistance to pathogens; SGT1/RAR1/HSP90/R protein complex mediates downstream MAP kinase activation and changes in defense gene expression and hormone levels; Functions in plant disease resistance signaling, SCF(TIR1) mediated degradation of Aux/IAA proteins and HSP90 mediated degradation of R resistance proteins
description: SGT1 protein binding; suppressor of the g2 allelle of SKP1

name: PR5[AT1G75040]
additional_information: Thaumatin-like protein involved in response to pathogens.

name: AGO1[AT1G48410]
description: argonaute, stabilizer of iron transporter SufD / Polynucleotidyl transferase

name: SAGs[AT5G14930,AT5G45890]
additional_information: acyl hydrolase involved in senescence; EDS1/PAD4/SAG101 complex regulates HRT-mediated resistance against TCV. Cysteine protease, CK/AUX and sugar influenced.

name: CPIP[AT1G10350,AT3G08910]
additional_information: Putative in Arabidopsis. Capsid protein interacting proteins (CPIP) in Nicotiana tabacum (closest match to ntaCPIP1, ntaCPIP2a, ntaCPIP2b).

name: ATPB[ATCG00480]
additional_information: chloroplastic

name: NDR1[AT3G20600]
additional_information: Downstream of CC-NBS-LRR-mediated resistance; Late embryogenesis abundant (LEA) hydroxyproline-rich glycoprotein family. Mediates SAR; resistance against bacterial and fungal pathogens. Involved in disease resistance. Required for resistance conferred by multiple R genes recognizing different bacterial and oomycete pathogen isolates like avirulent P.syringae or H.parasitica (downy mildew). Required for the establishment of hypersensitive response (HR) and systemic acquired resistance (SAR) after infection with the bacterial pathogen P.syringae DC3000 carrying avrRpt2. Required for resistance to the soilborne fungus V.longisporum. Interaction with RIN4 is required for the activation of the R gene RPS2 and RPS2-mediated resistance. The mRNA is cell-to-cell mobile.

name: RIN4[AT3G25070]
additional_information: Member of the R protein complex. Essential regulator of plant defense, which plays a central role in resistance in case of infection by a pathogen. It is a common target for both type III avirulence proteins from P.syringae (AvrB, AvrRpm1 and AvrRpt2) and for the plant Resistance (R) proteins RPM1 and RPS2.

name: MIND1[AT5G24020]
additional_information: chloroplastic; septum site-determining protein (MIND)

name: NPR1[AT1G64280]
additional_information: This gene is a key regulator of the salicylic acid (SA)-mediated systemic acquired resistance (SAR) pathway.

name: TGA2,5,6[AT3G12250,AT5G06950,AT5G06960]
additional_information: TGA6 encodes a basic leucine zipper transcription factor involved in the activation of SA-responsive genes. TGA2 interacts with NPR1 and may regulate PR gene expression. TGA5encodes a basic leucine zipper (B-ZIP) containing protein that interacts with NPR1 to promote expression of salicylic acid induced genes. Binds the ocs-element.

name: NPR1 high & JAZ low
description: High NPR1 activity, low JAZ activity

name: NPR1 high & JAZ high
description: High NPR1 activity, high JAZ activity

name: RANGAP[AT3G63130]
additional_information: GTPase activator for the nuclear Ras-related regulatory protein Ran, converting it to the putatively inactive GDP-bound state.

name: OBE1|WRKY17

name: WRKY17[AT2G24570]
additional_information: Calmodulin binding.

name: OBE1|WRKY11
all_pathways: Regulation - Transcription & Translation,Signalling - Perception and resistance genes

name: WRKY11[AT4G31550]
additional_information: Calmodulin binding.

name: CO[AT5G15840,SOTUB02G033400.1.1]
additional_information: constans transcription factor. Encodes a protein showing similarities to zinc finger transcription factors, involved in regulation of flowering under long days. Acts upstream of FT and SOC1.; Plays a role in the regulation of flowering time by acting on 'SUPPRESSOR OF OVEREXPRESSION OF CO1', 'TERMINAL FLOWER 1' and 'FLOWERING LOCUS T'. Also regulates P5CS2 and ACS10 (involved in proline and ethylene biosynthesis, respectively).
description: B-box type zinc finger protein with CCT domain-containing protein

name: COI1[AT2G39940]
additional_information: RNI-like superfamily protein. Assembles SCF COI1 ubiquitin-ligase complexes in planta. A single amino acid substitution in the F-box motif of COI1 abolishes the formation of the SCF(COI1) complexes and results in loss of the JA response. Required for wound- and jasmonates-induced transcriptional regulation.

name: AT3G17020[AT3G17020]
description: Adenine nucleotide alpha hydrolases-like superfamily protein

name: HEN1[AT4G20910]
additional_information: HEN1 is a methyltransferase that methylates miRNAs and siRNAs on the ribose of the last nucleotide. The 3'-end methylation probably protects the 3' ends of the small RNAs from uridylation.

name: N-pyruvoyl-L-Glu
additional_information: Byproduct of SA biosynthesis

name: GST|SA

additional_information: Detoxification. Actually implicated in early response (glutathione S-transferase).

name: flg22
additional_information: Flagellin is the structural protein that forms the major portion of flagellar filaments; this is the 22 amino acids flagellin peptide known as flg22 (spans 22 amino acids in the core of the conserved domain). Flagellins from different bacterial species vary in their central part but show conservation of their N-terminal and C-terminal regions.

name: BAK1[AT4G33430]
additional_information: Brassinosteroids
description: BRI1-associated receptor kinase; somatic embryogenesis receptor-like kinase 3

name: FLS2[AT5G46330]
additional_information: Encodes a leucine-rich repeat serine/threonine protein kinase that is expressed ubiquitously. FLS2 is involved in MAP kinase signalling relay involved in innate immunity. Essential in the perception of flagellin, a potent elicitor of the defense response. FLS2 is directed for degradation by the bacterial ubiquitin ligase AvrPtoB. The mRNA is cell-to-cell mobile.
description: Leucine-rich receptor-like protein kinase family protein; PRR protein flagellin sensing 2

name: MKS1[AT3G18690]
additional_information: Encodes a nuclear-localized member of a plant specific gene family involved in mediating responses to pathogens. Interacts with WRKY transcriptional regulators.

name: GA
additional_information: active forms (gibberellin A1, gibberellin A3, gibberellin A4)

name: SLR1[LOC_OS06G03710]
description: transcriptional repressor of the gibberellin (GA) signaling pathway

name: DELLA[AT1G14920,AT1G66350,AT2G01570,AT3G03450,AT5G17490]
additional_information: GA signalling cascade is composed of GA receptors (GIDa/b/c), DELLA repressor proteins and F-box proteins which control the stability of DELLA. Structurally, DELLA belong to the GRAS family of transcriptional regulators, with the DELLA motif (not present in other GRAS family members). Probably acts by participating in large multiprotein complexes that repress transcription of GA-inducible genes. In contrast to RGA, it is less sensitive to GA; The protein undergoes degradation in response to GA via the 26S proteasome. GAI may be involved in reducing ROS accumulation in response to stress by up-regulating the transcription of superoxide dismutases. RGL1 may be involved in reducing ROS accumulation in response to stress by up-regulating the transcription of superoxide dismutases. Rapidly degraded in response to GA. Promotes the biosynthesis of abscisic acid (ABA), especially in seed coats to maintain seed dormancy.

name: ESP|WRKY53
all_pathways: Regulation - Transcription & Translation,Signalling - Perception and resistance genes

name: ESP[AT1G54040]
additional_information: Antagonistically interacts with WRKY53. Involved in pathogen resistance and leaf senescence. Modulated by JA and SA equilibrium.

name: AUX/IAA[AT1G04100,AT1G04240,AT1G04250,AT1G04550,AT1G15050,AT1G15580,AT1G51950,AT1G52830,AT1G80390,AT2G01200,AT2G22670,AT2G33310,AT2G46990,AT3G04730,AT3G15540,AT3G16500,AT3G17600,AT3G23030,AT3G23050,AT3G62100,AT4G14550,AT4G14560,AT4G28640,AT4G29080,AT4G32280,AT5G25890,AT5G43700,AT5G57420,AT5G65670]
additional_information: JA-induced leaf senescence; auxin-responsive protein IAA29; Aux/IAA proteins are short-lived transcriptional factors that function as repressors of early auxin response genes at low auxin concentrations. Repression is thought to result from the interaction with auxin response factors (ARFs), proteins that bind to the auxin-responsive promoter element (AuxRE). Formation of heterodimers with ARF proteins may alter their ability to modulate early auxin response genes expression.

name: SCL14[AT1G07530]
additional_information: GRAS family transcription factor. The protein interacts with the TGA2 transcription factor and affects the transcription of stress-responsive genes. Probable transcription factor involved in plant development.

name: MYC2[AT1G32640]
additional_information: MYC2, MYC3, MYC4 are JAZ-interacting transcription factors (with a typical DNA binding domain of a basic helix-loop-helix leucine zipper motif) that act together to control jasmonate-related defense responses. MYC2 binds to an extended G-Box promoter motif and interacts with Jasmonate ZIM-domain proteins. Related bHLH TFs MYC3 and MYC4 also regulate both overlapping and distinct MYC2-regulated functions in Arabidopsis while MYC2 orthologs act as 'master switches' that regulate JA-mediated biosynthesis of secondary metabolites.

name: CAT|LSD1
all_pathways: Signalling - Cell death,Signalling - Reactive oxygen species (ROS)

name: CAT[AT1G20620,AT1G20630,AT4G35090,SOTUB12G027890.1.1]
additional_information: Catalase, catalyzes the breakdown of hydrogen peroxide (H2O2) into water and oxygen. Catalyzes the reduction of hydrogen peroxide using heme group as cofactor. Loss of function mutations have increased H2O2 levels and increased H2O2 sensitivity.

name: MAX2[AT2G42620]
additional_information: MAX2 binds to the activated D14 to induce SL-mediated ubiquitination (signalling).
description: E3 ubiquitin ligase SCF complex F-box subunit; more axillary branches 2

name: D14[AT3G03990]
additional_information: D14; Strigolactone esterase D14; α/β hydrolase DWARF14. D14 is the SL receptor

name: UGT[AT1G22400,AT2G36750,AT2G36800,AT5G05860,AT5G05870]
additional_information: UGT76C1 and UGT76C2 recognized all cytokinins and glucosylated the hormones at the N7 and N9 positions. UGT85A1, UGT73C5, and UGT73C1 recognized trans-zeatin and dihydrozeatin, which have an available hydroxyl group for glucosylation and formed the O-glucosides.

name: AHK2,3,4[AT1G27320,AT2G01830,AT5G35750]
additional_information: CK receptor

name: NIMIN[AT1G02450,AT1G09415,AT3G25882]
additional_information: Encodes a kinase that physically interacts with NPR1/NIM1. NIMIN1 modulates PR gene expression according the following model: NPR1 forms a ternary complex with NIMIN1 and TGA factors upon SAR induction that binds to a positive regulatory cis-element of the PR-1 promoter, termed LS7. This leads to PR-1 gene induction.

name: ACC
additional_information: An alpha-amino-acid anion resulting from the deprotonation of the carboxy group of 1-aminocyclopropanecarboxylic acid.  Direct precursor of ethylene.

name: ACO[AT1G05010,AT1G12010,AT1G62380,AT1G77330,AT2G19590,SOTUB07G018820.1.1]
additional_information: Ethylene-forming enzyme. ACOs belong to a large family of dioxygenases that require iron (Fe2+) as co-factor and bicarbonate as activator (HOM03D000012). Expression of the AtACO2 transcripts is affected by ethylene.

name: ROS
additional_information: Family of ROS compounds, including: hydrogen peroxide, hydroperoxyl radical, superoxide anion, ozone, hydroxyl radical

name: MDA
additional_information: Malonaldehyde (MDA) occurs widely in biological systems undergoing severe oxidative stress. Prolonged exposure of Arabidopsis resulted in damage to leaf tissue.

additional_information: SKP1 is a core component of the SCF family of E3 ubiquitin ligases and serves to tether the rest of the complex to an F-box protein, which provides specificity in binding to ubiquitin ligase substrate proteins.

name: RBX[AT3G42830,AT5G20570]
additional_information: RING/U-box superfamily protein

additional_information: Encodes an Arabidopsis Cullin family proteins, a cullin that is a component of SCF ubiquitin ligase complexes involved in mediating responses to auxin and jasmonic acid.

name: OPCL1[AT1G20510]
additional_information: OPC8 undergoes three rounds of beta-oxidation involving three enzymes to yield (+)- 7-iso -jasmonic acid which equilibrates to the more stable (-)-JA (part 1). OPCL1: physiological role in JA biosynthesis was confirmed for only this gene.

name: MFP[AT3G06860,AT3G15290,AT4G29010]

name: JAR[AT2G46370,AT4G03400]
additional_information: JAR1 is the enzyme responsible for the conjugation of JA with isoleucine (JA-Ile). GH family in KEGG (K14487) contains additional 17 members to this one.

name: CYP94[AT2G27690,AT3G48520]
additional_information: CYP94B3 is a jasmonoyl-isoleucine-12-hydroxylase that catalyzes the formation of 12-OH-JA-Ile from JA-Ile. Gene expression is induced in response to wounding and jasmonic acid treatment.
description: cytochrome P450, family 94, subfamily C, polypeptide 1,3

name: MES[AT2G23560,AT2G23580,AT2G23600,AT2G23620,AT4G37150,PGSC0003DMG400000756,SOTUB02G012040.1.1]
additional_information: MES(1,2,4,7,9) appears to be involved in MeSA hydrolysis in planta. Expression of MES7, MES9 can restore systemic acquired resistance in SAR-deficient tobacco plants. MES4 encodes a protein shown to have carboxylesterase activity and methyl salicylate esterase activity in vitro.

name: ICS[AT1G18870,AT1G74710]
additional_information: Encodes a protein with isochorismate synthase activity. Mutants fail to accumulate salicylic acid.

name: PAL[AT2G37040,AT3G10340,AT3G53260,AT5G04230]
additional_information: PAL4, a putative a phenylalanine ammonia-lyase. PAL3 differs significantly from PAL1 and PAL2 and other sequenced plant PAL genes.

name: BA
additional_information: Secondary metabolites derived from benzoic acid (BA) are of central importance in the interactions of plants with pests, pathogens, and symbionts and are potentially important in plant development.

name: AAO[AT1G04580,AT2G27150,AT5G20960]
additional_information: Encodes aldehyde oxidase AAO1, AAO3, AAO4 preferentially expressed in developing seeds. AAO3 encodes the aldehyde oxidase delta isoform catalyzing the final step in abscisic acid biosynthesis.

name: PYL[AT1G01360,AT2G40330]
additional_information: Functions as abscisic acid sensor.
all_pathways: Hormone - Abscisic acid (ABA),Signalling - Perception and resistance genes
description: regulatory components of ABA receptor family protein

name: SAMC[AT1G34065,AT4G39460]
additional_information: SAMC1 encodes a plastid metabolite transporter required for the import of S-Adenosylmethionine from the cytosol.

name: SAGT[AT2G43820,AT2G43840]
additional_information: Induced by Salicylic acid, virus, fungus and bacteria. Involved in the tryptophan synthesis pathway. UGT74F1 transfers UDP:glucose to salicylic acid (forming a glucoside), benzoic acid, quercetin, and athranilate in vitro.

name: SOD[AT1G08830,AT1G12520,AT2G28190,AT3G56350,AT5G18100]
additional_information: Copper/zinc superoxide dismutase. CSD1 encodes a cytosolic copper/zinc superoxide dismutase that can detoxify superoxide radicals. Its expression is affected by miR398-directed mRNA cleavage. Regulated by biotic and abiotic stress. CCS encodes copper chaperone for SOD1 (delivers copper to the Cu-Zn superoxide dismutase). CSD2 can detoxify superoxide radicals. SOD is a iron/manganese superoxide dismutase. CSD3 is a putative peroxisomal CuZnSOD inducible by a high-light pulse.

name: O2
additional_information: ROS precursors

name: RBOH[AT1G09090,AT1G19230,AT1G64060,AT3G45810,AT4G11230,AT4G25090,AT5G07390,AT5G47910,AT5G51060,AT5G60010,SOTUB06G025550.1.1,SOTUB06G025580.1.1,SOTUB08G028720.1.1]
additional_information: Respiratory burst oxidase. NADPH-oxidase RBOHB plays a role in seed after-ripening. Major producer of superoxide in germinating seeds. RBOHF interacts with RBOHD to fine tune the spatial control of ROI production and hypersensitive response to cell in and around infection site. RBOHC is required for the production of reactive oxygen species in response to extracellular ATP stimulus. The increase in ROS production stimulates Ca2+ influx.

name: CPS[AT4G02780,SOTUB06G034690.1.1]
additional_information: Terpenoid cyclases/Protein prenyltransferases superfamily protein

name: KS[AT1G79460]
additional_information: Terpenoid cyclases/Protein prenyltransferases superfamily protein

additional_information: Encodes a gibberellin 2-oxidase that acts on C19 gibberellins

name: GA-methylester
description: Gibberellin A1, A3, A4 methyl ester

name: β-Carotene
additional_information: A cyclic carotene obtained by dimerisation of all-trans-retinol. A strongly-coloured red-orange pigment abundant in plants and fruit and the most active and important provitamin A carotenoid.
all_pathways: Hormone - Strigolactones (SL),Hormone - Abscisic acid (ABA),Secondary metabolism - Terpenoids

name: CLA
additional_information: Carlactone (CL) is the common precursor for all known SLs, but must be modified by cytochrome P450 enzymes of the MAX1 family to form carlactonoic acid (CLA) or other active derivatives.

name: CL
additional_information: Carlactone (CL) is a compound with strigolactone-like biological activities.  CL is the common precursor for all known SLs, but must be modified by cytochrome P450 enzymes of the MAX1 family to form carlactonoic acid (CLA) or other active derivatives.

name: MAX1[AT2G26170]
additional_information: Carlactone (CL), is the common precursor for all known SLs, but must be modified by cytochrome P450 enzymes of the MAX1 family to form carlactonoic acid (CLA) or other active derivatives.
description: cytochrome P450, family 711, subfamily A, polypeptide 1; more axillary branches 1

name: ISPH[AT4G34350]
additional_information: methylerythritol phosphate pathway. Arabidopsis ISPH is involved in the plastid nonmevalonate pathway of isoprenoid biosynthesis. It was shown to complement the lethal phenotype of E. coli ispH mutant and is therefore most likely encodes a protein with 4-hydroxy-3-methylbut-2-en-1-yl diphosphate reductase activity involved in the last step of mevalonate-independent isopentenyl biosynthesis.

name: IPT1,3,4,5,6,7,8[AT1G25410,AT1G68460,AT3G19160,AT3G23630,AT3G63110,AT4G24650,AT5G19040]
additional_information: IPT4,6,8 are not normally expressed in the vegetative phase. This grouping draws from doi:10.1073/pnas.0603522103 (IPT1,IPT3,IPT5,IPT7 in planta), doi:10.1074/jbc.M102130200 (IPT6, IPT8, in ecoli), doi:10.1093/pcp/pce112 (IPT4, in callus).

name: phospholipids
description: Common membrane phospholipids, such as phosphatidylcholine (PC) and phosphatidylethanolamine (PE)

name: JASSY[AT1G70480]
additional_information: chloroplast outer membrane protein, required for OPDA translocation from chloroplast to cytoplasm

name: EIN3(like)[AT2G27050,AT3G20770]
additional_information: Ethylene insensitive 3 and Ethylene insensitive 3-like

name: Phenolics production
description: Phenolic compounds  (such as coumaric acid) production, leading towards alkaloids, and the destruction of pathogens/insects.

name: CYP735A1,A2[AT1G67110,AT5G38450]
description: cytochrome P450, family 735, subfamily A, polypeptide 1,2

name: miR168[AT4G19395]
additional_information: Encodes a microRNA that targets AGO1. MIR168a is highly expressed and predominantly produces a 21-nt miR168 species. By contrast, MIR168b is expressed at low levels and produces an equal amount of 21- and 22-nt miR168 species. Only the 21-nt miR168 is preferentially stabilized by AGO1.

name: TRX-H[AT1G45145,AT5G42980]
additional_information: Only TRX3/5 are implicated in rx00096 (NPR complex monomerisation).

name: ARF[AT1G19850,AT2G33860,AT5G60450,AT5G62000]
additional_information: ARF3 is a target of the ta-siRNA tasiR-ARF. ARF4 appears to have redundant function with ETT(ARF3) in specifying abaxial cell identity. Formation of heterodimers with Aux/IAA proteins may alter their ability to modulate early auxin response genes expression. Promotes flowering, stamen development, floral organ abscission and fruit dehiscence. Functions independently of ethylene and cytokinin response pathways. May act as a repressor of cell division and organ growth.

name: TAS3[AT3G17185,AT5G49615]
additional_information: Encodes a trans-acting siRNA (tasi-RNA) that regulates the expression of auxin response factor genes (ARF2, ARF4, ETT). One of 3 genomic loci that encode the TAS3 siRNA. In contrast to the single mRNA binding family, TAS3 requires the guide mRNA miR390 bind the transcript at two sites. The transcript is then cleaved at the 3’ binding site only, by AGO7. As is the case for the TAS1, TAS2, and TAS3 families, RDR6 then synthesizes the dsRNA fragment which is further processed by DCL4.

name: UPL5[AT4G12570]
additional_information: Regulates leaf senescence through ubiquitination and subsequent degradation of WRKY53.
description: ubiquitin protein ligase, HECT E3 class

name: CAMTA3[AT2G22300,SOTUB04G020530.1.1]
additional_information: Transcription factor. Repressor of SA defence. Encodes a putative CAM binding transcription factor. Loss of function mutations show enhanced resistance to fungal and bacterial pathogens suggesting that CAMTA functions to suppress defense responses.

name: SR1IP1[AT5G67385]
additional_information: Mediates cullin 3 (CAMTA3) based proteasome degradation. Phototropic-responsive NPH3-like protein. May act as a substrate-specific adapter of an E3 ubiquitin-protein ligase complex (CUL3-RBX1-BTB) which mediates the ubiquitination and subsequent proteasomal degradation of target proteins.

name: vsiRNA34327
description: virus-derived small interfering RNA targeting GA1

name: vsiRNA12986
description: virus-derived small interfering RNA targeting GA20ox

name: MYB33,44,65[AT3G11440,AT5G06100,AT5G67300,SOTUB06G030530.1.1]
additional_information: gibberellin induced TF

name: miR159AB[AT1G18075,AT1G73687]
additional_information: Encodes microRNA’s that target several MYB family members. miR159A and miR159B function redundantly. Plants that are doubly mutated for miR159AB have curled leaves and reduced stature.

name: miR319a-3p[MIR319A-3P]
additional_information: Harbors general WRKY binding W-box regulatory element. In Arabidopsis, predominantly targets TCP transcription factor genes, and in contrast, statistical as well as experimentally established criteria have suggested that miR319 should be as efficient in targeting MYB33 and MYB65 as miR159.

name: D53[OS11G0104300]
additional_information: Substrate of the SCFD3 ubiquitination complex, Repressor of strigolactone (SL) signalling

name: HMA[AT1G63440,AT5G44790]
additional_information: HMA transporter

name: CTS[AT4G39850]
additional_information: Encodes a peroxisomal protein of the ATP binding cassette (ABC) transporter class (PMP subfamily).

name: MOS[AT1G80680,AT4G02150,AT5G05680]
additional_information: Involved in basal resistance against bacterial pathogens.

name: RTE1[AT2G26070]
additional_information: In Arabidopsis, it appears to be involved in the negative regulation of the response to ethylene, is localized to the Golgi and is a positive regulator of ETR1.

name: EIN2[AT5G03280]
additional_information: EIN2 transporter. Involved in ethylene signal transduction. Acts downstream of CTR1.
description: EIN2 transporter, NRAMP metal ion transporter family protein

name: MPK4[AT4G01370]
additional_information: Encodes a nuclear and cytoplasmically localized MAP kinase involved in mediating responses to pathogens. Its substrates include MKS1 and probably MAP65-1.

name: ERF6[AT4G17490]
additional_information: Probably acts as a transcriptional activator. Binds to the GCC-box pathogenesis-related promoter element. May be involved in the regulation of gene expression by stress factors and by components of stress signal transduction pathways.

name: Phytoene
all_pathways: Hormone - Strigolactones (SL),Hormone - Abscisic acid (ABA),Secondary metabolism - Terpenoids

name: SL
additional_information: Strigolactones derive from carotenoids via a pathway involving the carotenoid cleavage dioxygenases 7 and 8 (CCD7 and CCD8) and the iron-binding protein D27 DOI:10.1126/science.1218094

name: ABA
additional_information: ABA is an important sesquiterpenoid plant hormone which acts as a regulator of plant responses to environmental stresses such as drought and cold.

name: ERF104[AT5G61600]
additional_information: Encodes a member of the ERF (ethylene response factor) subfamily B-3 of ERF/AP2 transcription factor family

name: GRX480[AT1G28480]
additional_information: GRX480 interacts with TGA factors and suppresses JA-responsive PDF1.2 transcription. GRX480 transcription is SA-inducible and requires NPR1.

name: WAK1[AT1G21250,AT1G21270]
additional_information: WAK1 and WAK2 bind in vitro to OGs. Required during plant's response to pathogen infection and in plant defense against heavy metal toxicity. Phosphorylates the oxygen-evolving enhancer protein 2 (OEE2) in an GRP-3-dependent manner.

name: OG
additional_information: damage/host associated molecular patterns; Oligogalacturonides (OGs) are oligomers of alpha-1,4-linked galacturonosyl residues released from plant cell walls upon partial degradation of homogalacturonan.

name: BETA-OHASE[AT1G31800,AT4G25700,AT5G52570]
additional_information: AT1G31800 (LUT5) is putatively included based on KEGG.

name: γ-Carotene
all_pathways: Hormone - Strigolactones (SL),Hormone - Abscisic acid (ABA),Secondary metabolism - Terpenoids

name: WRKY8[AT5G46350]
additional_information: Member of WRKY Group II-c. WRKY8 has a role in mediating the long-distance movement of crucifer-infecting tobacco mosaic virus (TMV-cg).

name: WRKY28[AT4G18170]
additional_information: Member of WRKY Transcription Factor; Group II-c. Involved in the activation of salicylic acid biosynthesis genes ICS1 and PBS3. The results obtained here confirm results from our multiple microarray co-expression analyses indicating that WRKY28 and WRKY46 are transcriptional activators of ICS1 and PBS3, respectively.

name: WRKY48[AT5G49520]
additional_information: Encodes WRKY48, a member of the WRKY Transcription Factor. WRKY48 is a stress- and pathogen-induced transcriptional activator that represses plant basal defense.

name: CBP60G[AT5G26920]
additional_information: Calmodulin binding. Inducible by both bacterial pathogen and MAMP (microbe-associated molecular pattern) treatments. Bacterial growth is enhanced in cbp60g mutants. cbp60g mutants also show defects in salicylic acid (SA) accumulation and SA signaling.

name: BIK1[AT2G39660]
additional_information: Cytoplasmic receptor.

name: ARR-B[AT1G49190,AT1G67710,AT2G01760,AT2G25180,AT2G27070,AT3G16857,AT3G62670,AT4G16110,AT4G31920,AT5G07210,AT5G58080]
additional_information: type-B positive response regulator

name: EIN5[AT1G54490]
additional_information: EIN5 (XRN4) does not appear to regulate ethylene signaling via an RNA-INDUCED SILENCING COMPLEX-based RNA silencing mechanism but acts by independent means.

name: ERF/EDF[AT1G04370,AT1G13260,AT1G25560,AT1G68840,AT2G44840,AT3G23220,AT3G23230,AT3G23240,AT3G25730,AT4G17500,AT5G43410,AT5G47220,AT5G61600]
additional_information: EDF4 encodes an AP2/B3 domain transcription factor which is upregulated in response to low temperature. EDF1 is a novel transcriptional regulator involved in ethylene signaling, with promoter bound by EIN3. Rav2 is part of a complex that has been named 'regulator of the (H+)-ATPase of the vacuolar and endosomal membranes' (RAVE).

name: PR3[AT3G12500]
additional_information: Encodes a basic chitinase involved in ethylene/jasmonic acid mediated signalling pathway during systemic acquired resistance based on expression analyses.

name: NPR1 low & JAZ low
description: Low NPR1 activity, low JAZ activity

name: PR4[AT3G04720]
additional_information: mRNA levels increase in response to ethylene and turnip crinkle virus infection.

name: JAM[AT1G01260,AT2G46510,AT4G16430]
additional_information: basic helix-loop-helix (bHLH) DNA-binding superfamily protein

name: CLH[AT1G19670]
additional_information: Its expression is induced rapidly by methyljasmonate, a known promoter of senescence and chlorophyll degradation.

name: JR1[AT3G16470]
additional_information: Mannose-binding lectin superfamily protein

name: PR13[AT1G72260]
additional_information: Encodes a thionin which is a cysteine rich protein having antimicrobial properties. Thi2.1 is expressed in response to a variety of pathogens and induced by ethylene and jasmonic acid. Belongs to the plant thionin (PR-13) family.

name: VSP[AT5G24770,AT5G24780]
additional_information: Induced in response to abscisic acid, jasmonic acid, salt, water deficiency and wounding.

name: CTR[AT5G03730]
additional_information: CTR1 has long been presumed to function, like Raf, as a mitogen-activated protein kinase kinase kinase (MAPKKK).

name: PR1[AT2G14580,AT2G14610,SOTUB09G006090.1.1,SOTUB09G006100.1.1,SOTUB09G006110.1.1]
additional_information: PR1 gene expression is induced in response to a variety of pathogens. Expression of PR1B is salicylic-acid responsive. Salicylic acid represses gene expression.

name: MIR390[AT2G38325,AT5G58465]
additional_information: Encodes a microRNA that targets the TAS3 family of tasiRNA-generating transcripts. Cleavage of TAS3 transcripts by miR390 initiates processing of these transcripts in a 21-nucleotide register.

name: MAPKKK8[AT4G08500]
additional_information: MAP3K/MEKK family A1 subgroup member (4 in total: MEKK1/2/3/4).

name: SEN4[AT4G30270]
additional_information: Encodes a protein similar to endo xyloglucan transferase in sequence. It is also very similar to BRU1 in soybean, which is involved in brassinosteroid response.
description: senescence 4 / meristem 5; similar to endo xyloglucan transferase in sequence

name: MYB113[AT1G66370]
additional_information: MYB domain protein 113. Involved in regulation of anthocyanin biosynthesis. Affects the expression of enzymes involved in later steps of anthocyanin biosynthesis; Transcription activator, when associated with BHLH002/EGL3/MYC146, BHLH012/MYC1, or BHLH042/TT8: Affects the expression of enzymes involved in later steps of anthocyanin biosynthesis.

name: ORA59[AT1G06160]
additional_information: ORA59 is the master regulator of the jasmonic acid-ET-induced defense program; class II TGAs at the ORA59 promoter constitute an important regulatory hub for the activation and SA suppression of ACC-induced genes.

name: ERF096[AT5G43410]
additional_information: Encodes a member of the ERF (ethylene response factor) subfamily B-3 of ERF/AP2 transcription factor family.

name: ERF1[AT3G23240,AT4G17500,SOTUB12G018730.1.1]
additional_information: Encodes member of the ERF (ethylene response factor) subfamily B-3 of ERF/AP2 transcription factor family (ERF1, ATERF-1).

name: ERF/ORA59[AT1G06160,AT4G17490,AT5G47230,AT5G51190]
additional_information: ORA59 is the master regulator of the jasmonic acid-ET-induced defense program; class II TGAs at the ORA59 promoter constitute an important regulatory hub for the activation and SA suppression of ACC-induced genes. ERF6 probably acts as a transcriptional activator. Binds to the GCC-box pathogenesis-related promoter element. May be involved in the regulation of gene expression by stress factors and by components of stress signal transduction pathways.

name: 3O3PP-CoA
additional_information: Benzoic acid (BA) precursor (beta oxidative route)

name: 3H3PP-CoA
additional_information: Benzoic acid (BA) precursor (beta oxidative route)

name: miR167e-3p[MIR167E-3P]
additional_information: sRNA predicted to regulate GA biosynthesis via translational repression of the StGA20ox transcript. Appears to be Solanaceae specific.

name: miR6022[MIR6022-3P]
additional_information: Harbors WRKY8/28/48 binding sites, promoter contains GAMYB binding site. The miR6022-relieved silencing of LRR-RLKs is predicted to modulate the immune response.

name: WRKY6,18[AT4G31800]
additional_information: WRKY6: Senescence- and defence-associated transcription factor. Acts as a positive or negative regulator. WRKY18: Pathogen-induced transcription factor. Not experimentally confirmed as a FunctionalCluster.

name: NAC032[AT1G77450]
additional_information: ABA induced NAC, representative of the TGA-dependent genes that are not suppressed by SA.

name: cis-prenyl-tRNA
additional_information: In the generation of this compound, IPT catalyses the first step of tRNA-adenine to N6-(3-methylbut-2-en-1-yl)-adenosine in tRNA, which is then reduced to cis-prenyl-tRNA.

additional_information: Lonely guy 1 throug Lonely guy 9

name: Ade
additional_information: Adenine is a nucleobase (a purine derivative)

description: BHLH transcription factor, phytochrome interacting factor 3

name: SP6A[PGSC0003DMG400023365,SOLTU.DM.05G026370.1]
additional_information: Predicted positive regulation of acetylcholine metabolic process.

name: SES[unknown]
description: small RNA: suppression of expression of SP6A

name: EIJP1[AT2G24860]
additional_information: DnaJ/Hsp40 cysteine-rich domain superfamily protein. Former Arabidopsis HSP40-like chaperone protein with an unknown function.

name: TOR[AT1G50030]
additional_information: Ser/Thr protein kinase that belongs to the phosphatidylinositol 3-kinase-related lipid kinase family

name: SA-Asp
additional_information: Salicylic acid - aspartate conjugate

name: LST8[AT2G22040,AT3G18140]
additional_information: LST8 plays an important role in growth and organ development, as well as metabolic regulation and flowering in response to long days.  LST8-1 (At3g18140) seems to be expressed at significant levels, while there appears to be no indication of expression of LST8-2 (At2g22040).

name: RAPTOR2[AT3G08850,AT5G01770]
additional_information: AtRaptor1A (At5g01770) locus cannot fully compensate in disruption of AtRaptor1B despite shared sequence and conserved raptor motifs. May be due to global lower levels of AtRaptor1A expression. In contrast, AtRaptor1B can fully complement the loss of AtRaptor1A expression.

name: NPR3[AT5G45110]
additional_information: Encodes NPR3, a paralog of NPR1. NPR3 and NPR4 are receptors for the immune signal salicylic acid.

name: NPR4[AT4G19660]
additional_information: NPR4 is required for basal defense against pathogens, and may be implicated in the cross-talk between the SA- and JA-dependent signaling pathways. NPR3 and NPR4 are receptors for the immune signal salicylic acid.

name: MKK1[AT4G26070]
additional_information: Member of MAP kinase kinase. Likely functions in a stress-activated MAPK pathway. Can phosphorylate MPK4 in response to stress. Gets phosphorylated by MEKK1 (MAPKKK8) in response to wounding. Can directly interact with senescence-related WRKY53 transcription factor on the protein level and can bind to its promoter. MAPK/ERK kinase kinase 1; Involved in the innate immune MAP kinase signaling cascade (MEKK1, MKK4/MKK5 and MPK3/MPK6) downstream of bacterial flagellin receptor FLS2. May be involved in the cold and salinity stress-mediated MAP kinase signaling cascade (MEKK1, MEK1/MKK2 and MPK4/MPK6). Activates downstream MKK2, MKK4 and MKK5.

name: SUR1[AT2G20610]
additional_information: Confers auxin overproduction. Mutants have an over-proliferation of lateral roots. Encodes a C-S lyase involved in converting S-alkylthiohydroximate to thiohydroximate in glucosinolate biosynthesis.

name: OSCA1.3[AT1G11960]
additional_information: Calcium channel that is phosphorylated by BIK1 in the presence of PAMPS and required for stomatal immunity.

name: MVA
additional_information: Precursor of isoprenoids and cholesterol

name: BRI1[AT4G39400]
description: Leucine-rich receptor-like protein kinase family protein

name: Brassinolide
additional_information: Brassinolide is the most active brassinosteroid (BR), a class of polyhydroxylated steroidal phytohormones in plants. BRs regulate a wide range of physiological processes including plant growth, development and immunity.

name: CYP79B2[AT4G39950]
description: cytochrome P450, family 79, subfamily B, polypeptide 2

name: CYP83B1[AT4G31500]
description: cytochrome P450, family 83, subfamily B, polypeptide 1

name: LECRK19[AT5G60300]
description: Concanavalin A-like lectin protein kinase family protein

name: FKBP65[AT5G48570]
description: FKBP-type peptidyl-prolyl cis-trans isomerase family protein

name: RDR1,6[AT1G14790,AT3G49500]
additional_information: RDRs are a family of proteins that produce double-stranded small RNA (sRNA) precursors by synthesizing the complementary strand of a single-stranded RNA template.

name: IAMT1[AT5G55250]
additional_information: Encodes an enzyme which specifically converts IAA to its methyl ester form MelIAA.

name: CYP81F4[AT4G37410]
description: cytochrome P450, family 81, subfamily F, polypeptide 4

name: eATP
additional_information: Extracellular ATP (eATP) is now recognized as an important signaling agent in plant growth and defense response to environmental stimuli.

name: PP2C[AT3G11410,SOLTU.DM.03G012480.1,SOLTU.DM.06G031720.1,SOTUB03G021270.1.1,SOTUB06G032210.1.1]
additional_information: Negative regulator of ABA signalling. Expressed in seeds during germination. mRNA up-regulated by drought and ABA.

name: BRAHMA[AT2G46020]
additional_information: Encodes a SWI/SNF chromatin remodeling ATPase

name: RD29[AT5G52300,AT5G52310,SOTUB03G014340.1.1]
additional_information: Encodes a protein that is induced in expression in response to water deprivation such as cold, high-salt, and desiccation. The response appears to be via abscisic acid.
all_pathways: Stress - Heat,Hormone - Abscisic acid (ABA),Stress - Drought,Stress - Waterlogging

name: CAU1[AT4G31120]
additional_information: Encodes a histone methylase, functions as an upstream suppressor of CAS, and via this interaction serves as an essential player in the [Ca2+]o-mediated stomatal closure and drought tolerance.

name: P5CS1[AT2G39800]
additional_information: P5CS1 appears to be involved in salt stress responses related to proline accumulation, including protection from reactive oxidative species.

name: BZR2[AT1G19350]
description: Brassinosteroid signaling positive regulator (BZR1) family protein

name: CYCD3-3[AT3G50070]
additional_information: Encode CYCD3;3, a CYCD3 D-type cyclin. Important for determining cell number in developing lateral organs. Mediating cytokinin effects in apical growth and development.

name: ADT[AT1G08250,AT1G11790,AT2G27820,AT3G07630,AT3G44720,AT5G22630]
additional_information: Encodes plastid-localized arogenate dehydratase involved in phenylalanine biosynthesis. 10.1074/jbc.M702662200: Three of the resulting recombinant proteins, encoded by ADT1 (At1g11790), ADT2 (At3g07630), and ADT6 (At1g08250), more efficiently utilized arogenate than prephenate, whereas the remaining three, ADT3 (At2g27820), ADT4 (At3g44720), and ADT5 (At5g22630) essentially only employed arogenate.

name: viral dsRNA
additional_information: Sources of viral dsRNA for generation of visRNA: (1) In positive strand (+) RNA viruses, the genome can be directly translated into replication proteins which associate with host proteins and viral RNA to form membranous structures where the negative (−) strands are synthesized, and double-stranded replication intermediates are formed, (2) In negative strand (−) RNA viruses, transcription (relying on viral RDR) leads to the production of messenger RNA (mRNA) which can form dsRNA by pairing with the genomic RNA, (3) In negative strand (−) RNA viruses, genomic RNA replication that leads to the formation of antigenome, complementary to the genomic RNA, can base-pair with genomic RNA, serving as the source of dsRNAs (4) In DNA viruses, overlapping transcription and transcripts with self-complementary regions are sources of dsRNA,  (5) Aberrant RNAs produced due to cleavage by certain vsiRNAs, are acted upon by RDRPs1/6 to produce long dsRNAs.

name: DCL2,4[AT3G03300,AT5G20320]
additional_information: In Arabidopsis, DCL2 and DCL4 process double-stranded RNA into 22 and 21 nucleotide small interfering (si)RNAs, respectively, and have overlapping functions with regards to virus and transgene silencing. DCL2 and DCL4 functions are mostly redundant.

name: vsiRNA
additional_information: siRNAs are derived from dsRNA precursors in a DCL dependent manner. During virus infection, endogenous as well as virus-derived small RNAs enable the plants to devise an appropriate strategy to counter the attack.

name: me-vsiRNA
additional_information: sRNA duplexes formed during RNA silencing are protected from degradation through 2′–O-methylation of their 3′ ends by HEN1.

name: HC-Pro|vsiRNA
description: In viral suppression of RNA-Silencing, Hc-Pro binds to vsiRNAs.

name: MS[AT3G03780,AT5G17920]
additional_information: Encodes a cytosolic methionine synthase, involved in methionine regeneration via the activated methyl cycle (or SAM cycle).

name: GSNO[AT5G43940]
additional_information: Gene expression is reduced by wounding and induced by salicylic acid. Required for the acclimation of plants to high temperature, and for fertility.

name: HUP54[AT4G27450]
description: aluminum induced protein with YGL and LRDR motifs

name: EDS5[AT4G39030]
additional_information: Exports SA to cytosol. Essential component of salicylic acid-dependent signaling for disease resistance. Member of the MATE-transporter family. Expression induced by salicylic acid. Mutants are salicylic acid-deficient.

name: psbB[ATCG00680]
description: photosystem II reaction center protein B

name: CAC2[AT5G35360]
description: acetyl Co-enzyme a carboxylase biotin carboxylase subunit

name: ATPC1[AT4G04640]
description: ATPase%2C F1 complex%2C gamma subunit protein
